sen.j: 書根麻呂（ふみのねまろ、生年不詳 - 慶雲4年（707年）9月21日）は、日本の飛鳥時代の人物である。
sen.e: FUMI no Nemaro (year of birth unknown - September 21, 707) lived in the Asuka period in Japan.
FUMI no Nemaro (year of birth unknown - October 25, 707) lived during Japan's Asuka period.
FUMI no Nemaro (year of birth unknown - October 25, 707) lived during Japan's Asuka period.

sen.j: 氏は文とも、名は尼麻呂、祢麻呂（禰麻呂）とも書く。
sen.e: His clan name was also written as Fumi (文) and his given name could also be written as Nemaro (尼麻呂, 祢麻呂 and 禰麻呂)
His clan name Fumi (書) was also written as 文 and his given name Nemaro (根麻呂) was also written as 尼麻呂, 祢麻呂 and 禰麻呂.
sen.cmt: 漢字表記を追加しました。
sen.e: His clan name Fumi (書) was also written as 文 and his given name Nemaro (根麻呂) was also written as 尼麻呂, 祢麻呂 and 禰麻呂.

sen.j: 旧仮名遣いでの読みは「ふみのねまろ」で同じ。
sen.e: His name was also pronounced as "FUMI no Nemaro" in old Japanese syllabary characters.
In the old Japanese kana syllabary, too, his name was pronounced as "FUMI no Nemaro."
sen.cmt: 同じの意味を分かりやすくしました。
sen.e: In the old Japanese kana syllabary, too, his name was pronounced as "FUMI no Nemaro."

sen.j: 姓は首、後に連、さらに後に忌寸。
sen.e: His hereditary title was Obito (one of the lower title under Yamato dynasty), later awarded Muraji (second highest title under Yamato dynasty) and finally granted Imiki (fourth highest of the eight hereditary titles).

His hereditary title was Obito (one of the lower titles under Yamato dynasty), and later he was awarded Muraji (seventh highest of the eight hereditary titles) and finally granted Imiki (fourth highest).
sen.cmt: second highestの後でfourth highestのtitleを持つのは不自然なので、「連」が格下げになった後として解釈しました。
sen.e: His hereditary title was Obito (one of the lower titles under Yamato dynasty), and later he was awarded Muraji (seventh highest of the eight hereditary titles) and finally granted Imiki (fourth highest).

sen.j: 672年の壬申の乱で天武天皇の側で近江方面の将として戦った。
sen.e: He was a general in Omi area on the side of Emperor Tenmuh in the Jinshin War in 672.
He was a general in Omi area on the side of Emperor Tenmu in the Jinshin War of 672.
He was a general in Omi area on the side of Emperor Tenmu in the Jinshin War of 672.

sen.j: 後に左衛士府督。
sen.e: Later he was upgraded to Captain of the Left Division of the Outer Palace Guards.
Later he was upgraded to Captain of the Left Division of the Outer Palace Guards.
Later he was upgraded to Captain of the Left Division of the Outer Palace Guards.

sen.j: 江戸時代に墓が発掘され、後に埋葬品が国宝に指定された。
sen.e: His tomb was excavated in the Edo period and the buried properties were designated as national treasure later.
His tomb was excavated in the Edo period and the buried properties were designated as national treasures later.
His tomb was excavated in the Edo period and the buried properties were designated as national treasures later.

tit.e: His achievement in the Jinshin War.
His achievement in the Jinshin War
tit.cmt: タイトルなのでピリオドは削除しました。
tit.e: His achievement in the Jinshin War

sen.j: 書氏（文氏）は渡来系の氏族である。
sen.e: Fumi clan were immigrants to ancient Japan.
Fumi clan were immigrants to ancient Japan.
Fumi clan were immigrants to ancient Japan.

sen.j: 壬申の乱が勃発したとき、根麻呂は大海人皇子の舎人であった。
sen.e: Nemaro was one of Prince Oama's toneri (palace servants) when the Jinshin War started.
Nemaro was one of Prince Oama's toneri (palace servants) when the Jinshin War started.
Nemaro was one of Prince Oama's toneri (palace servants) when the Jinshin War started.

sen.j: 6月24日に皇子が挙兵を決断して吉野宮を去り、東に向かったとき、付き従う者はその妻子と舎人ら20数名、女官10数名しかいなかった。
sen.e: When the prince decided to take up arms and departed Yoshino no miya toward the east, his followers were only his wife, children, two dozen vassals and more than a dozen court ladies.
When the prince decided to take up arms and departed Yoshino no miya toward the east on July 27, his followers were only his wife, children, two dozen vassals and more than a dozen court ladies.
sen.cmt: 日付が抜けていたので新暦に変換して追記しました。
sen.e: When the prince decided to take up arms and departed Yoshino no miya toward the east on July 27, his followers were only his wife, children, two dozen vassals and more than a dozen court ladies.

sen.j: 書根麻呂はこの一行の中にいた。
sen.e: FUMI no Nemaro was in this party.
FUMI no Nemaro was in this party.
FUMI no Nemaro was in this party.

sen.j: 無事に美濃国にたどりつき、兵力を集めた大海人皇子は、7月2日に軍勢を二手にわけて、近江国に直行する部隊と倭（大和国）に向かう部隊に進発を命じた。
sen.e: After Prince Oama got to Mino province safely and raised his army, he divided the army into two and ordered one to go to Omi province directly and the other to Yamato (Yamato province).
After Prince Oama got to Mino Province safely and raised his army, he divided the army into two on August 3 and ordered one to go to Omi Province directly and the other to Yamato (Yamato province).
sen.cmt: Provinceを大文字にし、日付を新暦に変換して追加しました。
sen.e: After Prince Oama got to Mino Province safely and raised his army, he divided the army into two on August 3 and ordered one to go to Omi Province directly and the other to Yamato (Yamato province).

sen.j: 書根麻呂は村国男依、和珥部君手、胆香瓦安倍とともに近江に向かう将となった。
sen.e: FUMI no Nemaro was assigned to a general heading to Omi province together with MURAKUNI no Oyori, WANIBE no Kimite and IKAGO no Ahe.
FUMI no Nemaro was assigned to a general heading to Omi Province together with MURAKUNI no Oyori, WANIBE no Kimite and IKAGO no Ahe.
FUMI no Nemaro was assigned to a general heading to Omi Province together with MURAKUNI no Oyori, WANIBE no Kimite and IKAGO no Ahe.

sen.j: 彼等は7月7日に息長の横河で近江を破ったのを皮切りに、9日には鳥籠山で、13日に安河浜で勝利を重ねて前進した。
sen.e: They first defeated Omi at Okinaga-no-Yokokawa river on July 7, they moved forward with further victories at Tokono-yama mountain on 9th and Yasunokawa-hama shore on 13th.
Following the first victory over Omi at Okinaga-no-Yokokawa River on August 8, they moved forward with further victories at Tokono-yama Mountain on 10th and Yasunokawa-hama Shore on 14th.
sen.cmt: 固有名詞を大文字にしました。日付を新暦に変換しました。
sen.e: Following the first victory over Omi at Okinaga-no-Yokokawa River on August 8, they moved forward with further victories at Tokono-yama Mountain on 10th and Yasunokawa-hama Shore on 14th.

sen.j: 17日には敵の本拠である近江宮のそばで栗太の軍を破り、22日に瀬田に到達した。
sen.e: On the 17th, they were victorious at Kurumoto near Omi no miya where their enemy's headquarters were located, and got to Seta on the 22nd.
On the 18th, they defeated the force in Kurita near Omi no miya where their enemy's headquarters were located, and got to Seta on the 23nd.
sen.cmt: 栗太はKuritaです。日付を新暦に変換しました。
sen.e: On the 18th, they defeated the force in Kurita near Omi no miya where their enemy's headquarters were located, and got to Seta on the 23nd.

sen.j: この日の戦いで弘文天皇が指揮した大軍は敗れた。
sen.e: A large force led by Emperor Kobun was defeated at this combat on this day.
A large force led by Emperor Kobun was defeated at this combat on this day.
A large force led by Emperor Kobun was defeated at this combat on this day.

sen.j: 翌日大友皇子は自殺し、内乱は終結した。
sen.e: On the following day, Prince Otomo committed suicide and the domestic conflict ended.
On the following day, Prince Otomo committed suicide and the domestic conflict ended.
sen.cmt: 余分なスペースを削除しました。
sen.e: On the following day, Prince Otomo committed suicide and the domestic conflict ended.

tit.e: His achievement in the Jinshin War.

sen.j: 『日本書紀』には、天武天皇元年（672年）12月4日に勲功ある人を選んで冠位を増し、小山位以上をあたえたとする記事がある。
sen.e: According to "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), on December 4, the number of cap rank was increased to grant a shosen (cap rank) or upper rank to those who were selected for their deed of valor.
sen.cmt: 一原文一翻訳の例外対処
sen.e: According to "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), on December 31, 672, those who were selected for their deed of valor were promoted to a shosen (cap rank) or upper rank.
sen.cmt: 日付を新暦にしました。また「冠位を増し」は昇任の意でthe number of cap rank was increasedという事実はありません。
sen.e: According to "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), on December 31, 672, those who were selected for their deed of valor were promoted to a shosen (cap rank) or upper rank.

sen.j: そのため根麻呂もこれと同じかそれ以上の位を受けたと思われる。
sen.e: Therefore, Nemaro was granted the same or higher rank.
sen.cmt: 一原文一翻訳の例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, Nemaro was supposed to be granted the same or higher rank.
sen.cmt: 「と思われる」を追記しました。
sen.e: Therefore, Nemaro was supposed to be granted the same or higher rank.

sen.j: また、文尼麻呂が過去の論功で100戸の封を与えられたことが、『続日本紀』大宝 (日本)元年（701年）7月21日条に見える。
sen.e: July 21 of "Shoku Nihongi" (Chronicle of Japan Continued) reported that FUMI no Nemaro was allotted 100 households for his previous merits.
An article of July 21, 701 of "Shoku Nihongi" (Chronicle of Japan Continued) reported that FUMI no Nemaro was allotted 100 households for his previous merits.
sen.cmt: 年号を追記しました。ここでは条の日付なので新暦に変換していません。
sen.e: An article of July 21, 701 of "Shoku Nihongi" (Chronicle of Japan Continued) reported that FUMI no Nemaro was allotted 100 households for his previous merits.

sen.j: 天武天皇12年（683年）9月23日に、文首など38氏が連の姓を与えられた。
sen.e: On September 23, 683, 38 clans including FUMI no Obito were awarded the title 'Muraji'.
On October 21, 683, 38 clans including FUMI no Obito were awarded the title 'Muraji'.
sen.cmt: 日付を新暦にしました。
sen.e: On October 21, 683, 38 clans including FUMI no Obito were awarded the title 'Muraji'.

sen.j: 天武天皇14年（685年）6月20日に、文連など11氏が忌寸の姓を与えられた。
sen.e: On June 20, 685, 11 clans including FUMI no Muraji were awarded the title 'Imiki'.
On July 29, 685, 11 clans including FUMI no Muraji were awarded the title 'Imiki'.
sen.cmt: 日付を新暦にしました。
sen.e: On July 29, 685, 11 clans including FUMI no Muraji were awarded the title 'Imiki'.

sen.j: 後に発掘された墓誌から、書根麻呂が最終的に左衛士府督となったことがわかる。
sen.e: A epitaph excavated later proved that FUMI no Nemaro was a Captain of the Left Division of Outer Palace Guards in the end.
A epitaph excavated later proved that FUMI no Nemaro was a Captain of the Left Division of Outer Palace Guards in the end.
A epitaph excavated later proved that FUMI no Nemaro was a Captain of the Left Division of Outer Palace Guards in the end.

sen.j: 衛士府の督（長官）は武官の要職である。
sen.e: The captain of the division of guards is an important post in military officers.
The captain of the division of guards is an important post in military officers.
The captain of the division of guards is an important post in military officers.

sen.j: 慶雲4年（707年）に文祢麻呂は死んだ。
sen.e: In 707, FUMI no Nemaro died.
In 707, FUMI no Nemaro died.
In 707, FUMI no Nemaro died.

sen.j: 従四位下であった。
sen.e: He was Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade).
He was Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade).
He was Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade).

sen.j: 元明天皇は、使者を遣わして詔を述べさせ、壬申の年の功により正四位上と絁（あしぎぬ、絹布の一種）・布を贈った。
sen.e: Empress Genmei sent an envoy to state an imperial edict and granted Shoshiinojo (Senior Fourth Rank Upper Grade) together with thick silk fabric (silk cloth) and cloth for his achievements in the Jinshin War.

Empress Genmei sent an envoy to state an imperial edict and granted Shoshiinojo (Senior Fourth Rank Upper Grade) together with thick silk fabric (silk cloth) and cloth for his achievements in the Jinshin War.

Empress Genmei sent an envoy to state an imperial edict and granted Shoshiinojo (Senior Fourth Rank Upper Grade) together with thick silk fabric (silk cloth) and cloth for his achievements in the Jinshin War.

sen.j: 『続日本紀』のこの記事では10月24日に卒したとあるが、後述する墓誌では9月21日である。
sen.e: "Shoku Nihongi" (Chronicle of Japan Continued) reported that he died on October 24, but the epitaph mentioned later says he died on September 21.
"Shoku Nihongi" (Chronicle of Japan Continued) reported that he died on October 24, but the epitaph mentioned later says he died on September 21.
"Shoku Nihongi" (Chronicle of Japan Continued) reported that he died on October 24, but the epitaph mentioned later says he died on September 21.

sen.j: 江戸時代の1831年（天保2年）9月に、文祢麻呂の墓碑が発掘された。
sen.e: In September, 1831, the Edo period, the tomb of FUMI no Nemaro was excavated.
In October 1831 in the Edo period, the tomb of FUMI no Nemaro was excavated.
sen.cmt: 日付を新暦にしました。
sen.e: In October 1831 in the Edo period, the tomb of FUMI no Nemaro was excavated.

sen.j: 場所は現在の奈良県宇陀市榛原区八滝である（北緯34度30分3.5秒東経135度58分35.3秒）。
sen.e: It is located in Yataki, Haibara Ward, Uda City, Nara Prefecture (at northern latitude 34.30.3.5 and east longitude 135.58.35.3)
It is located in Yataki, Haibara Ward, Uda City, Nara Prefecture (at northern latitude 34.30.3.5 and east longitude 135.58.35.3)
It is located in Yataki, Haibara Ward, Uda City, Nara Prefecture (at northern latitude 34.30.3.5 and east longitude 135.58.35.3)

sen.j: 火葬した骨は、ガラスの壺の中におさめられ、それが布でくるまれてさらに金銅製の壺におさめられていた。
sen.e: His ashes were kept in a glass urn was wrapped by cloth and the glass urn was stored in a gilt bronze-made urn.
His ashes were kept in a glass urn, wrapped by cloth, and further stored in a gilt bronze-made urn.
His ashes were kept in a glass urn, wrapped by cloth, and further stored in a gilt bronze-made urn.

sen.j: 銅の箱に入った銅製の墓誌板には、壬申年将軍左衛士府督正四位上文祢麻 呂忌寸慶雲四年歳次丁未九月廿一日卒 とあった。
sen.e: A copper epitaph board kept in a copper box was inscribed that a general in the Jinshin War, Captain of the Left Division of Outer Palace Guards, jitei (old man at the age of 61 to 65, later changed to 60 to 64 under ritsuryo system) FUMI no Nemaro Imiki passed away on September 21, 707.

A copper epitaph board kept in a copper box was inscribed that a general in the Jinshin War, Captain of the Left Division of Outer Palace Guards, jitei (old man at the age of 61 to 65, later changed to 60 to 64 under ritsuryo system) FUMI no Nemaro Imiki passed away on September 21, 707.
sen.cmt: 全角スペースを半角にしました。(史跡の記述なので日付は新暦にしていません）
sen.e: A copper epitaph board kept in a copper box was inscribed that a general in the Jinshin War, Captain of the Left Division of Outer Palace Guards, jitei (old man at the age of 61 to 65, later changed to 60 to 64 under ritsuryo system) FUMI no Nemaro Imiki passed away on September 21, 707.

sen.j: その後墓は埋め戻され、出土品は地元の龍泉寺に納められた。
sen.e: Later, his tomb was buried again and artifacts were placed in a local Ryusen-ji Temple.
Later, his tomb was buried again and artifacts were placed in a local Ryusen-ji Temple.
Later, his tomb was buried again and artifacts were placed in a local Ryusen-ji Temple.

sen.j: 1952年（昭和27年）国宝に指定され、現在は東京国立博物館が所蔵している。
sen.e: In 1952, the artifacts were designated as national treasures and the Tokyo National Museum owns them at present.
In 1952, the artifacts were designated as national treasures and the Tokyo National Museum owns them at present.
In 1952, the artifacts were designated as national treasures and the Tokyo National Museum owns them at present.

sen.j: 1982年（昭和57年）に再調査が行われ、墓誌出土場所のすぐそばで墓の跡が見つかり、『文祢麻呂墓』として1984年（昭和59年）4月5日に国の史跡に指定された。
sen.e: The remains of his tomb were discovered near the epitaph found during reinvestigation in 1982 and the remain was designated as a historic site as "tomb of FUMI no Nemaro" on April 5, 1984.
The remains of his tomb were discovered near the epitaph found during reinvestigation in 1982 and the remains were designated as a historic site as "tomb of FUMI no Nemaro" on April 5, 1984.
sen.cmt: remain wasを複数に修正しました。
sen.e: The remains of his tomb were discovered near the epitaph found during reinvestigation in 1982 and the remains were designated as a historic site as "tomb of FUMI no Nemaro" on April 5, 1984.
